title: Branzino Mediterranean Recipe
description: Whole branzino stuffed with fresh herbs are perfectly roasted with lemon until flaky and tender for an impressive fish dinner full of Greek flavor.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Seafood Fish Branzino Mediterranean 4.8 (47) 37 Reviews 28 Photos Branzino, also known as European sea bass, is a delicious white fish with a mild flavor. I like to cook them whole, stuffed with lemon wedges, fresh oregano, and rosemary before roasting them for an easy dinner full of Greek flavor. Submitted by Christala Updated on March 25, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 28 28 28 28 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 tablespoons olive oil, divided 1 red onion, chopped salt and ground black pepper to taste 2 whole Branzino (sea bass) fish, cleaned 4 lemon wedges, divided 2 sprigs fresh rosemary ½ cup white wine ¼ cup lemon juice 1 tablespoon fresh oregano leaves ¼ cup chopped Italian flat-leaf parsley Directions Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Drizzle 1 tablespoon olive oil into a large baking pan; add red onion and season with salt and pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place 2 whole branzino fish into the baking pan. Stuff each cavity with 1 lemon wedge, 1 rosemary sprig, and some of the red onion in the pan. Pour white wine and lemon juice over fish and sprinkle with oregano. Drizzle remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil over fish. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until fish is opaque and flakes easily with a fork, about 25 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Gently slide a spatula between the bones to separate fish; remove all the bones. Serve fish on a platter; garnish with parsley and 2 lemon wedges. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook’s Note Sprinkle red pepper flakes on top of the fish before cooking to add a little zip to the flavor.Vegetables such as celery, pepper, or tomatoes can also be added to the pan and fish cavity.You can also try grilling it and flipping it over once.  I Made It Print 97 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 380 Calories 13g Fat 7g Carbs 53g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 380 % Daily Value * Total Fat 13g 16% Saturated Fat 2g 12% Cholesterol 117mg 39% Sodium 237mg 10% Total Carbohydrate 7g 2% Dietary Fiber 1g 5% Total Sugars 2g Protein 53g 106% Vitamin C 25mg 28% Calcium 58mg 4% Iron 1mg 8% Potassium 855mg 18% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Branzino Mediterranean 01 of 28 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 28 Photo by  Rebekah Cobbett 11/20/2023 Absolutely amazing! Found the fish at Costco and never made it. It’s very light and flaky, wonderful flavor. I added minced garlic and herbs also a little fish sauce and it was delicious! 03 of 28 Photo by  Elvia Krawczyk 05/01/2021 Delicious, my husband even like it . Nice flavor will be making again . 04 of 28 Photo by  Higama916 12/04/2020 It was delicious and fairly easy to make. I added tomatoes and red pepper flakes like it said on notes. I also added additional lemon juice and baked at 350 for an additional 15 min then broiled it for another 5 mins to get the top a little coloring. 05 of 28 Photo by  Higama916 12/04/2020 It was delicious and fairly easy to make. I added tomatoes and red pepper flakes like it said on notes. I also added additional lemon juice and baked at 350 for an additional 15 min then broiled it for another 5 mins to get the top a little coloring. 06 of 28 Photo by  Dan Mignone 07/27/2020 07 of 28 Photo by  wsamara 11/25/2019 08 of 28 Photo by  gbilz 11/14/2019 09 of 28 Photo by  Buckwheat Queen 07/20/2019 This works perfectly. The exact cooking times will depend on how big your fish are. I’ve made it many times and it always comes out moist and tender. I’ve also used orata instead of branzino. Thank you for the recipe. 10 of 28 Photo by  Buckwheat Queen 07/20/2019 This works perfectly. The exact cooking times will depend on how big your fish are. I’ve made it many times and it always comes out moist and tender. I’ve also used orata instead of branzino. Thank you for the recipe. 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Sockeye Salmon with Preserved Lemon Beurre Blanc 3 Ratings Parchment Baked Salmon 95 Ratings Baked Salmon in Foil 55 Ratings Salmon in Creamy Silk Sauce 27 Ratings Garlic Lemon Butter Salmon 44 Ratings Lemon Dill Salmon with Garlic, White Wine, and Butter Sauce 42 Ratings Flounder Mediterranean 294 Ratings Fantastic Lemon Butter Fillet 412 Ratings Stephan's Broiled Salmon Pesto 227 Ratings Grilled Salmon Fillets with a Lemon, Tarragon, and Garlic Sauce 108 Ratings Broiled Salmon with Lemon and Dill 12 Ratings Garlic Salmon 558 Ratings Grilled Salmon with Avocado Dip 237 Ratings Sous Vide Mahi Mahi with Jalapeno-Lime Butter 3 Ratings Easy Lemon Pepper Blackened Salmon 78 Ratings Pan Seared Salmon II 38 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
